page.title: 16Boldron Church and Chapel
page.content: Built in{1887-8}and commonly called Boldron Church,its accurate name is Boldron Mission Room.It is in the {Parish of Startforth}which in August 1980 was amalgamated with the{Parish {of Bowes,}thus leaving three separate churches in the care of the Reverend Carlos D'Aguiar. It is not licensed for weddings,but baptisms can take place there.Every fortnight alternate services of Holy Communion and Morning Prayer attract a congregation of 18-20,an excellent proportion of the population. A recent survey has uncovered dry rot in a wooden lintel and there is a risk that the bell tower may fall down unless remedial work is done. The Primitive Methodist Chapel in Boldron is even older.It was erected in{1867}beside the village green and can accommodate up to 140 people.
